intro: Brongniartia proteranthera, commonly known as the Brazilian velvet tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
